           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

           * there's spacing. */

          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;

        for LitElement.

            <chops-button class="de-emphasized discard-button">
              Discard
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized" disabled="">

            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </form>
      </chops-dialog>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1239910: Security: Web GPU - Out of bound object manupilation in WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData()
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1239910: Security: Web GPU - Out of bound object manupilation in WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData()
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      loobe...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/285938" title="loobe...@gmail.com"><!---->loobe...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      loobe...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->loobe...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Sat, Aug 14, 2021, 8:29 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Aug 14, 2021, 8:29 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Aug 14, 2021, 8:29 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>    Specifically crafted HTML file can cause Out of bound object manupilation in Web GPU code WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData(). This bug may be potantially exploited to achieve one click remote code execution in  renderer process.<span class="line"><!---->    Specifically crafted HTML file can cause Out of bound object manupilation in Web GPU code WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData(). This bug may be potantially exploited to achieve one click remote code execution in  renderer process.<!----></span><br><br><br>	WebGPUImplementation uses a flat map to maintain the mapping of request_adapter_serial and request_adapter_callback callback:<span class="line"><!---->	WebGPUImplementation uses a flat map to maintain the mapping of request_adapter_serial and request_adapter_callback callback:<!----></span><br>		<span class="line"><!---->		<!----></span><br>	  base::flat_map<DawnRequestDeviceSerial, base::OnceCallback<void(bool)>><span class="line"><!---->	  base::flat_map&lt;DawnRequestDeviceSerial, base::OnceCallback&lt;void(bool)&gt;&gt;<!----></span><br>		  request_device_callback_map_;<span class="line"><!---->		  request_device_callback_map_;<!----></span><br><br>	When navigator.gpu.requestAdapter() is called in JS,  WebGPUImplementation::RequestAdapterAsync() increases request_adapter_serial by one and addes one entry to request_adapter_callback_map_ and sends out the actual GPU adapter request:<span class="line"><!---->	When navigator.gpu.requestAdapter() is called in JS,  WebGPUImplementation::RequestAdapterAsync() increases request_adapter_serial by one and addes one entry to request_adapter_callback_map_ and sends out the actual GPU adapter request:<!----></span><br><br>		void WebGPUImplementation::RequestAdapterAsync()<span class="line"><!---->		void WebGPUImplementation::RequestAdapterAsync()<!----></span><br>		{<span class="line"><!---->		{<!----></span><br>		  ...<span class="line"><!---->		  ...<!----></span><br>		  DawnRequestAdapterSerial request_adapter_serial = NextRequestAdapterSerial();<span class="line"><!---->		  DawnRequestAdapterSerial request_adapter_serial = NextRequestAdapterSerial();<!----></span><br>		  ...<span class="line"><!---->		  ...<!----></span><br>		  request_adapter_callback_map_[request_adapter_serial] =<span class="line"><!---->		  request_adapter_callback_map_[request_adapter_serial] =<!----></span><br>			  std::move(request_adapter_callback);<span class="line"><!---->			  std::move(request_adapter_callback);<!----></span><br>		  helper_->RequestAdapter(request_adapter_serial,<span class="line"><!---->		  helper_-&gt;RequestAdapter(request_adapter_serial,<!----></span><br>								  static_cast<uint32_t>(power_preference));<span class="line"><!---->								  static_cast&lt;uint32_t&gt;(power_preference));<!----></span><br>		  ...<span class="line"><!---->		  ...<!----></span><br>		}<span class="line"><!---->		}<!----></span><br><br>	When data returns, the request_adapter_callback is looked up by the request_adapter_serial. The corresponding request_adapter_callback gets executed and then it get erased from the request_adapter_callback_map_:<span class="line"><!---->	When data returns, the request_adapter_callback is looked up by the request_adapter_serial. The corresponding request_adapter_callback gets executed and then it get erased from the request_adapter_callback_map_:<!----></span><br><br>		void WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData()<span class="line"><!---->		void WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData()<!----></span><br>			  ...<span class="line"><!---->			  ...<!----></span><br>			  DawnRequestAdapterSerial request_adapter_serial =<span class="line"><!---->			  DawnRequestAdapterSerial request_adapter_serial =<!----></span><br>				  returned_adapter_info->header.request_adapter_serial;<span class="line"><!---->				  returned_adapter_info-&gt;header.request_adapter_serial;<!----></span><br>			  auto request_callback_iter =<span class="line"><!---->			  auto request_callback_iter =<!----></span><br>				  request_adapter_callback_map_.find(request_adapter_serial);<span class="line"><!---->				  request_adapter_callback_map_.find(request_adapter_serial);<!----></span><br>			  ...<span class="line"><!---->			  ...<!----></span><br>			  std::move(request_callback)<span class="line"><!---->			  std::move(request_callback)<!----></span><br>				  .Run(adapter_service_id, adapter_properties, error_message);<span class="line"><!---->				  .Run(adapter_service_id, adapter_properties, error_message);<!----></span><br>			  request_adapter_callback_map_.erase(request_callback_iter);<span class="line"><!---->			  request_adapter_callback_map_.erase(request_callback_iter);<!----></span><br><br>	If a customed then getter is defined in JS:<span class="line"><!---->	If a customed then getter is defined in JS:<!----></span><br><br>		Object.prototype.__defineGetter__("then", function() { navigator.gpu.requestAdapter();});<span class="line"><!---->		Object.prototype.__defineGetter__("then", function() { navigator.gpu.requestAdapter();});<!----></span><br><br>	The customed getter code would be executed in the same context of that request_adapter_callback.<span class="line"><!---->	The customed getter code would be executed in the same context of that request_adapter_callback.<!----></span><br>	If a requestAdapter() JS statement is put in the customed getter, it would cause the size change (from 1 to 2) of the request_adapter_callback_map_ as stated above. This mutation happens before the return of the first request_adapter_callback ( "std::move(request_callback).Run(adapter_service_id, adapter_properties, error_message)" ).<span class="line"><!---->	If a requestAdapter() JS statement is put in the customed getter, it would cause the size change (from 1 to 2) of the request_adapter_callback_map_ as stated above. This mutation happens before the return of the first request_adapter_callback ( "std::move(request_callback).Run(adapter_service_id, adapter_properties, error_message)" ).<!----></span><br><br>	Because the flat_map request_adapter_callback_map_ is actually vector behind the scence:<span class="line"><!---->	Because the flat_map request_adapter_callback_map_ is actually vector behind the scence:<!----></span><br><br>		template <class Key,<span class="line"><!---->		template &lt;class Key,<!----></span><br>				  class Mapped,<span class="line"><!---->				  class Mapped,<!----></span><br>				  class Compare = std::less<>,<span class="line"><!---->				  class Compare = std::less&lt;&gt;,<!----></span><br>				  class Container = std::vector<std::pair<Key, Mapped>>><span class="line"><!---->				  class Container = std::vector&lt;std::pair&lt;Key, Mapped&gt;&gt;&gt;<!----></span><br>		class flat_map : public ::base::internal::<span class="line"><!---->		class flat_map : public ::base::internal::<!----></span><br>							 flat_tree<Key, internal::GetFirst, Compare, Container> {	<span class="line"><!---->							 flat_tree&lt;Key, internal::GetFirst, Compare, Container&gt; {	<!----></span><br>						 <span class="line"><!---->						 <!----></span><br>	The mutation of request_adapter_callback_map_ invalidates request_callback_iter before Run() returns. <span class="line"><!---->	The mutation of request_adapter_callback_map_ invalidates request_callback_iter before Run() returns. <!----></span><br>	Therefore, after Run() returns, what the iterator (request_callback_iter) points to, no longer belongs to the container. Further operations against it actually manipulates on a out of bound non existing object.<span class="line"><!---->	Therefore, after Run() returns, what the iterator (request_callback_iter) points to, no longer belongs to the container. Further operations against it actually manipulates on a out of bound non existing object.<!----></span><br>	<span class="line"><!---->	<!----></span><br>	An ASAN report is also attached for your easy asessment.<span class="line"><!---->	An ASAN report is also attached for your easy asessment.<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span><br>VERSION<b         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>    Specifically crafted HTML file can cause Out of bound object manupilation in Web GPU code WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData(). This bug may be potantially exploited to achieve one click remote code execution in  renderer process.<span class="line"><!---->    Specifically crafted HTML file can cause Out of bound object manupilation in Web GPU code WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData(). This bug may be potantially exploited to achieve one click remote code execution in  renderer process.<!----></span><br><br><br>	WebGPUImplementation uses a flat map to maintain the mapping of request_adapter_serial and request_adapter_callback callback:<span class="line"><!---->	WebGPUImplementation uses a flat map to maintain the mapping of request_adapter_serial and request_adapter_callback callback:<!----></span><br>		<span class="line"><!---->		<!----></span><br>	  base::flat_map<DawnRequestDeviceSerial, base::OnceCallback<void(bool)>><span class="line"><!---->	  base::flat_map&lt;DawnRequestDeviceSerial, base::OnceCallback&lt;void(bool)&gt;&gt;<!----></span><br>		  request_device_callback_map_;<span class="line"><!---->		  request_device_callback_map_;<!----></span><br><br>	When navigator.gpu.requestAdapter() is called in JS,  WebGPUImplementation::RequestAdapterAsync() increases request_adapter_serial by one and addes one entry to request_adapter_callback_map_ and sends out the actual GPU adapter request:<span class="line"><!---->	When navigator.gpu.requestAdapter() is called in JS,  WebGPUImplementation::RequestAdapterAsync() increases request_adapter_serial by one and addes one entry to request_adapter_callback_map_ and sends out the actual GPU adapter request:<!----></span><br><br>		void WebGPUImplementation::RequestAdapterAsync()<span class="line"><!---->		void WebGPUImplementation::RequestAdapterAsync()<!----></span><br>		{<span class="line"><!---->		{<!----></span><br>		  ...<span class="line"><!---->		  ...<!----></span><br>		  DawnRequestAdapterSerial request_adapter_serial = NextRequestAdapterSerial();<span class="line"><!---->		  DawnRequestAdapterSerial request_adapter_serial = NextRequestAdapterSerial();<!----></span><br>		  ...<span class="line"><!---->		  ...<!----></span><br>		  request_adapter_callback_map_[request_adapter_serial] =<span class="line"><!---->		  request_adapter_callback_map_[request_adapter_serial] =<!----></span><br>			  std::move(request_adapter_callback);<span class="line"><!---->			  std::move(request_adapter_callback);<!----></span><br>		  helper_->RequestAdapter(request_adapter_serial,<span class="line"><!---->		  helper_-&gt;RequestAdapter(request_adapter_serial,<!----></span><br>								  static_cast<uint32_t>(power_preference));<span class="line"><!---->								  static_cast&lt;uint32_t&gt;(power_preference));<!----></span><br>		  ...<span class="line"><!---->		  ...<!----></span><br>		}<span class="line"><!---->		}<!----></span><br><br>	When data returns, the request_adapter_callback is looked up by the request_adapter_serial. The corresponding request_adapter_callback gets executed and then it get erased from the request_adapter_callback_map_:<span class="line"><!---->	When data returns, the request_adapter_callback is looked up by the request_adapter_serial. The corresponding request_adapter_callback gets executed and then it get erased from the request_adapter_callback_map_:<!----></span><br><br>		void WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData()<span class="line"><!---->		void WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData()<!----></span><br>			  ...<span class="line"><!---->			  ...<!----></span><br>			  DawnRequestAdapterSerial request_adapter_serial =<span class="line"><!---->			  DawnRequestAdapterSerial request_adapter_serial =<!----></span><br>				  returned_adapter_info->header.request_adapter_serial;<span class="line"><!---->				  returned_adapter_info-&gt;header.request_adapter_serial;<!----></span><br>			  auto request_callback_iter =<span class="line"><!---->			  auto request_callback_iter =<!----></span><br>				  request_adapter_callback_map_.find(request_adapter_serial);<span class="line"><!---->				  request_adapter_callback_map_.find(request_adapter_serial);<!----></span><br>			  ...<span class="line"><!---->			  ...<!----></span><br>			  std::move(request_callback)<span class="line"><!---->			  std::move(request_callback)<!----></span><br>				  .Run(adapter_service_id, adapter_properties, error_message);<span class="line"><!---->				  .Run(adapter_service_id, adapter_properties, error_message);<!----></span><br>			  request_adapter_callback_map_.erase(request_callback_iter);<span class="line"><!---->			  request_adapter_callback_map_.erase(request_callback_iter);<!----></span><br><br>	If a customed then getter is defined in JS:<span class="line"><!---->	If a customed then getter is defined in JS:<!----></span><br><br>		Object.prototype.__defineGetter__("then", function() { navigator.gpu.requestAdapter();});<span class="line"><!---->		Object.prototype.__defineGetter__("then", function() { navigator.gpu.requestAdapter();});<!----></span><br><br>	The customed getter code would be executed in the same context of that request_adapter_callback.<span class="line"><!---->	The customed getter code would be executed in the same context of that request_adapter_callback.<!----></span><br>	If a requestAdapter() JS statement is put in the customed getter, it would cause the size change (from 1 to 2) of the request_adapter_callback_map_ as stated above. This mutation happens before the return of the first request_adapter_callback ( "std::move(request_callback).Run(adapter_service_id, adapter_properties, error_message)" ).<span class="line"><!---->	If a requestAdapter() JS statement is put in the customed getter, it would cause the size change (from 1 to 2) of the request_adapter_callback_map_ as stated above. This mutation happens before the return of the first request_adapter_callback ( "std::move(request_callback).Run(adapter_service_id, adapter_properties, error_message)" ).<!----></span><br><br>	Because the flat_map request_adapter_callback_map_ is actually vector behind the scence:<span class="line"><!---->	Because the flat_map request_adapter_callback_map_ is actually vector behind the scence:<!----></span><br><br>		template <class Key,<span class="line"><!---->		template &lt;class Key,<!----></span><br>				  class Mapped,<span class="line"><!---->				  class Mapped,<!----></span><br>				  class Compare = std::less<>,<span class="line"><!---->				  class Compare = std::less&lt;&gt;,<!----></span><br>				  class Container = std::vector<std::pair<Key, Mapped>>><span class="line"><!---->				  class Container = std::vector&lt;std::pair&lt;Key, Mapped&gt;&gt;&gt;<!----></span><br>		class flat_map : public ::base::internal::<span class="line"><!---->		class flat_map : public ::base::internal::<!----></span><br>							 flat_tree<Key, internal::GetFirst, Compare, Container> {	<span class="line"><!---->							 flat_tree&lt;Key, internal::GetFirst, Compare, Container&gt; {	<!----></span><br>						 <span class="line"><!---->						 <!----></span><br>	The mutation of request_adapter_callback_map_ invalidates request_callback_iter before Run() returns. <span class="line"><!---->	The mutation of request_adapter_callback_map_ invalidates request_callback_iter before Run() returns. <!----></span><br>	Therefore, after Run() returns, what the iterator (request_callback_iter) points to, no longer belongs to the container. Further operations against it actually manipulates on a out of bound non existing object.<span class="line"><!---->	Therefore, after Run() returns, what the iterator (request_callback_iter) points to, no longer belongs to the container. Further operations against it actually manipulates on a out of bound non existing object.<!----></span><br>	<span class="line"><!---->	<!----></span><br>	An ASAN report is also attached for your easy asessment.<span class="line"><!---->	An ASAN report is also attached for your easy asessment.<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>	Google Chrome	94.0.4603.0 (Official Build) dev (64-bit) (cohort: Dev)<span class="line"><!---->	Google Chrome	94.0.4603.0 (Official Build) dev (64-bit) (cohort: Dev)<!----></span><br>	<span class="line"><!---->	<!----></span>Revision	937de3c41c6f97659ce98d7afdff3e6722f2b6cc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" 19043.1110)<!----></span><br>	JavaScript	V8 9.4.125<span class="line"><!---->	JavaScript	V8 9.4.125<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b>  ( OOB_OnGpuControlReturnData_PoC.html )<span class="line"><!---->  ( OOB_OnGpuControlReturnData_PoC.html )<!----></span><br>	<script><span class="line"><!---->	Object.prototype.__defineGetter__("then", function() { navigator.gpu.requestAdapter();});<!----></span><br>	navigator.gpu.requestAdapter();<span class="line"><!---->	navigator.gpu.requestAdapter();<!----></span><br>	</script><span class="line"><!---->	&lt;/script&gt;<!----></span><br><br>STEPS TO REPRODUCE <span class="line"><!---->STEPS TO REPRODUCE <!----></span><br>	1) Run Chrome with option " --enable-features=WebGPUService --enable-blink-features=WebGPU ".(It does not need any command line option in production because the WebGPU feature is in origin trial)<span class="line"><!---->	1) Run Chrome with option " --enable-features=WebGPUService --enable-blink-features=WebGPU ".(It does not need any command line option in production because the WebGPU feature is in origin trial)<!----></span><br>	2) Open the PoC  ( OOB_OnGpuControlReturnData_PoC.html ) in Chrome.<span class="line"><!---->	2) Open the PoC  ( OOB_OnGpuControlReturnData_PoC.html ) in Chrome.<!----></span><br>	3) Chrome crashes in in WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData().<span class="line"><!---->	3) Chrome crashes in in WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData().<!----></span><br>    <span class="line"><!---->    <!----></span><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b         Thank you for the report! This looks like a real issue of vector iterator invalidation but due to the class of issue it will depend on the internals of how the vector gets resized. The fix should be simple but not making a consistent repro case.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for the report!         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>    Specifically crafted HTML file can cause Out of bound object manupilation in Web GPU code WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData(). This bug may be potantially exploited to achieve one click remote code execution in  renderer process.<span class="line"><!---->    Specifically crafted HTML file can cause Out of bound object manupilation in Web GPU code WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData(). This bug may be potantially exploited to achieve one click remote code execution in  renderer process.<!----></span><br><br><br>	WebGPUImplementation uses a flat map to maintain the mapping of stated above.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>    Specifically crafted HTML file can cause Out of bound object manupilation in Web GPU code WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData(). This bug may be potantially exploited to achieve one click remote code execution in  renderer process.<span class="line"><!---->    Specifically crafted HTML file can cause Out of bound object manupilation in Web GPU code WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData(). This bug may be potantially exploited to achieve one click remote code execution in  renderer process.<!----></span><br><br><br>	WebGPUImplementation uses a flat map to maintain the mapping of stated above.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>    Specifically crafted HTML file can cause Out of bound object manupilation in Web GPU code WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData(). This bug may be potantially exploited to achieve one click remote code execution in  renderer process.<span class="line"><!---->    Specifically crafted HTML file can cause Out of bound object manupilation in Web GPU code WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData(). This bug may be potantially exploited to achieve one click remote code execution in  renderer process.<!----></span><br><br><br>	WebGPUImplementation uses a flat map to maintain the mapping of request_adapter_serial and request_adapter_callback callback:<span class="line"><!---->	WebGPUImplementation uses a flat map to maintain the mapping of request_adapter_serial and request_adapter_callback callback:<!----></span><br>		<span class="line"><!---->		<!----></span><br>	  base::flat_map<DawnRequestDeviceSerial, base::OnceCallback<void(bool)>><span class="line"><!---->	  base::flat_map&lt;DawnRequestDeviceSerial, base::OnceCallback&lt;void(bool)&gt;&gt;<!----></span><br>		  request_device_callback_map_;<span class="line"><!----> one entry to request_adapter_callback_map_ and sends out the actual GPU adapter request:<span class="line"><!---->	When navigator.gpu.requestAdapter() is called in JS, request:<!----></span><br><br>		void WebGPUImplementation::RequestAdapterAsync()<span class="line"><!---->		void WebGPUImplementation::RequestAdapterAsync()<!----></span><br>		{<span request_adapter_callback is looked up by the request_adapter_serial. class="line"><!---->		void WebGPUImplementation::OnGpuControlReturnData()<!----></span><br>			  ...<span class="line"><!---->			  ...<!----></span><br>			  DawnRequestAdapterSerial defined in JS:<span class="line"><!---->	If a customed then getter is defined in JS:<!----></span><br><br>		Object.prototype.__defineGetter__("then", function() { navigator.gpu.requestAdapter();});<span class="line"><!---->		Object.prototype.__defineGetter__("then", function() { navigator.gpu.requestAdapter();});<!----></span><br><br>	The customed getter code would be executed in the same context of that request_adapter_callback.<span class="line"><!---->	The customed getter code would be executed in the same context of that request_adapter_callback.<!----></span><br>	If a requestAdapter() JS statement is put in the customed getter, it would cause the size change (from 1 to 2) of the request_adapter_callback_map_ as stated above. This mutation happens before the return of the first request_adapter_callback ( "std::move(request_callback).Run(adapter_service_id, adapter_properties, error_message)" ).<span class="line"><!---->	If a requestAdapter() JS statement is put in the customed getter, it would cause the size change (from 1 to 2) of the request_adapter_callback_map_ as stated above. This mutation happens before the return of the first request_adapter_callback ( "std::move(request_callback).Run(adapter_service_id, adapter_properties, error_message)" ).<!----></span><br><br>	Because the flat_map request_adapter_callback_map_ is actually vector behind the scence:<span class="line"><!---->	Because the flat_map request_adapter_callback_map_ is actually vector behind the scence:<!----></span><br><br>		template <class Key,<span class="line"><!---->		template &lt;class Key,<!----></span><br>				  class Mapped,<span class="line"><!---->				  class Mapped,<!----></span><br>				  class Compare = std::less<>,<span class="line"><!---->				  class Compare = std::less&lt;&gt;,<!----></span><br>				  class Container = std::vector<std::pair<Key, Mapped>>><span class="line"><!---->				  class Container = std::vector&lt;std::pair&lt;Key, Mapped&gt;&gt;&gt;<!----></span><br>		class flat_map : public ::base::internal::<span class="line"><!---->		class flat_map : public ::base::internal::<!----></span><br>							 flat_tree<Key, internal::GetFirst, Compare, Container> {	<span class="line"><!---->							 flat_tree&lt;Key, internal::GetFirst, Compare, Container&gt; {	<!----></span><br>						 <span class="line"><!---->						 <!----></span><br>	The mutation of request_adapter_callback_map_ invalidates request_callback_iter before Run() returns. <span class="line"><!---->	The mutation of request_adapter_callback_map_ invalidates request_callback_iter before Run() returns. <!----></span><br>	Therefore, after Run() returns, what the iterator (request_callback_iter) points to, no longer belongs to the container. Further operations against it actually manipulates on a out of bound non existing object.<span class="line"><!---->	Therefore, after Run() returns, what the iterator (request_callback_iter) points to, no longer belongs to the container.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        Convert issue to new template structure<h3 class="medium-heading">Convert issue to new template structure</h3>
        
          
            Pick a template: <label for="templateInput">Pick a template: </label>
            
              --Please choose a project template--<option value="">--Please choose a project template--</option>
              
                
                  Webview Bugs
                <option value="Webview Bugs">
                  Webview Bugs
                </option>
                
                   Vpython Wheel Request
                <option value=" Vpython Wheel Request">
                   Vpython Wheel Request
                </option>
                
                  (test)(new) postmortem tracking bug
                <option value="(test)(new) postmortem tracking bug">
                  (test)(new) postmortem tracking bug
                </option>
                
                  Android Issue
                <option value="Android Issue">
                  Android Issue
                </option>
                
                  Audio/Video Communication Bugs
                <option value="Audio/Video Communication Bugs">
                  Audio/Video Communication Bugs
                </option>
                
                  Audio/Video Issue
                <option value="Audio/Video Issue">
                  Audio/Video Issue
                </option>
                
                  Broken Webpage
                <option value="Broken Webpage">
                  Broken Webpage

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
